title: Malin Andersson shares touching tribute to her beloved late daughter Consy
text:
Malin Andersson enjoyed a little relaxation in the sunshine recently as she took time for a little self-care.

The star, 26, took to Instagram on Sunday to pay tribute to her daughter Consy, who sadly passed away in January aged just four weeks following a premature birth.

Consy, who she shares with now ex Tom Kemp, was born on December 23 by emergency Caesarean nearly two months early after a heart defect was detected at 33 weeks.

Taking her mind off things: Malin Andersson relaxed on holiday as she shared a touching tribute to her beloved late daughter Consy during baby loss awareness week

She was sadly too small, weighing in at 4lb 8oz to be operated on.

And sharing a beautiful picture of her baby on social media, Malin told her followers how much she was struggling to deal with the pain.

She wrote: 'I think about you and how you would be like every day. I love you baby girl. My heart hurts. Baby loss awareness week 9th-15th October. Let’s raise awareness ❤️ @babyloss.'

She wrote: 'I think about you and how you would be like every day. I love you baby girl. My heart hurts. Baby loss awareness week 9th-15th October. Let’s raise awareness ❤️ @babyloss'

After receiving words of support from her followers, she wrote: 'Thankyou everyone for such lovely and amazing words.

'It takes courage for you all to share your stories with time also. I am blessed to have amazing followers x.'

Malin is battling her way through her grief in an incredibly positive fashion, but it's fair to say she has had a tough time in recent years.

Brave: Malin is battling her way through her grief in an incredibly positive fashion, but it's fair to say she has had a tough time in recent years

Helping others in need: Malin has previously said she is trying her best to be positive

She lost her mother, also called Consy back in 2017 following a battle with cancer and she has also lost her father to cancer when she was just a year old.

Malin told The Sun just ten weeks after losing her daughter that she is trying her best to be positive.

She said: 'It would be easy to feel angry. I step outside and see lots of babies and I could look at them and think: "Why isn’t my girl here?"

'Or I could think: "What a beautiful baby." It’s the only way I can survive, otherwise depression will swallow me up. I’ll end up suicidal.

'I’ve just got this resilience. It’s been built into me that no one is around for long, and I guess with baby Consy I prepared for the worst.'

Forever love: Malin pictured with her beloved mother in a throwback image

She previously said: 'I’ve just got this resilience. It’s been built into me that no one is around for long, and I guess with baby Consy I prepared for the worst'
description: Malin Andersson enjoyed a little relaxation in the sunshine recently as she took time for a little self-care.
